list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Her mother tries to be trendy.

list_ex_of_english: Several trendier, more modern magazines or newspapers have thus been founded.
Parents do not want trendy socio-economic arguments about why their school is not as good as another.
I think the current trendy phrase is that "one must present a low profile".
I welcome the arrangements which have been made to tackle such trendy problems of the take-over situation as warehousing and concert parties.
Considered one of the trendiest tents, and attracts the occasional celebrity.
The trendy way to describe that is as the lack of a feel-good factor.
All that sounds terribly trendy, and in some cases it may not mean anything, but in this case it did.
The criminal sanction removal may not be enough to secure freedom from the new trendy action of breach of confidentiality.
